reviews.text: Definately the best Premier inn i have visited,staff very friendly, food in the restaurant was excellent and the all u can eat breakfasts were fantastic.
reviews.title: Excellent Premier Inn, Friendly Staff, and Excellent food, especially the breakfasts!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blue badge parking limited and not checked had to walk 100 metres on return at night
reviews.title: Great room, food and staff excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warm welcoming staff. Very hospitable, excellent customer service. Rooms clean & tidy. Good location near airport / airport parking / NEC.
reviews.title: Would stop here again

reviews.text: This is the gist of my comments left on their customer service survey:
reviews.title: Avoid unless you want poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mould on tiles. Noise from adjacent bedroom - seems it must have been a family type room but the guy in the next bedroom coughed all night. Drilling started at 8.35 am and I could hear a workman talking to someone on his mobile phone just outside my window - very annoying!!
reviews.title: Perfect stopover

reviews.text: Stayed here as two families and would recommend this hotel to anybody. The star of the weekend was the restaurant with excellent service and food and a Restaurant Manager who couldn't o enough for us. Clean, tidy and excellent all round.
reviews.title: First Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good place to stay if you are attending an event at the NEC.
reviews.title: Good hotel let down by the restuarant service

reviews.text: Free overnight car parking .Decent size bedroom with air conditioning.Our visit was only marred by very slow service for dinner in the restuarant.
reviews.title: Great service, comfortable and clean.

reviews.text: Shortage of staff was blamed
reviews.title: Fantastic stop over for the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and myself had a great time in the UK, part of it was because the Premier Inn gave us a good night sleep in their comfortable rooms and the breakfast was great. I would recommend it to everyone including families with children.
reviews.title: A typical Premier Inn

reviews.text: I booked this hotel in advance taking advantage of the excellent £29 rate for my visit to the Birmingham Dive Show at the NEC. I wasn't expecting much to be honest for that price but was very pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Comfortable and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually got a taxi to and from the NEC as had been on my feet all day, which costs about £5-£7 depending on company. I am sure it is walkable though if you didn't want to pay out for a taxi.
reviews.title: Impossible to find and best not be hungry...

reviews.text: Reception staff were great - very efficient and helpful and made a real effort to make sure you had everything you needed. Check in and out were both very smooth.The room was spotless and I like that they have different pillows (from hard to soft) to meet with their 'guaranteed good night's sleep' programme as well as manually controlled air conditioning / heating in the room.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfy and I did have a good night's sleep thank you!Despite the hotel being extremely busy with all the events going on at the NEC you couldn't hear a thing in the rooms, nice and quiet. Bath nice and deep and shower had good settings and the hair dryer had fairly decent power (as opposed to some hotel ones that are like a pathetic little waft of air!).
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.text: Breakfast (at £8.25) was also a pleasant surprise. The buffet was better quality than I was expecting with a great range of hot and cold foods and cereals and again the service from the staff was excellent and they ask when you are seated if you have any special requests such as vegetarian sausages, poached eggs etc.
reviews.title: Appalling service

reviews.text: I had previously stayed in this hotel for the same event at the NEC last year, and after one of the worst experiences I have had in a hotel I was reluctant to stay again this year. However, reading up on the reviews through out the previous months before booking I thought it was worth another go. Last year as in most premier inns the rooms and beds where perfect, it was the dreadful excuse of a restaurant that really let my visit down.
reviews.title: What a difference a year makes!!!

reviews.text: Well what a difference a year has made to this hotel and in particular the restaurant and bar area. We received a five star service through out, nothing was to much trouble, all the staff from the start to the end of our meal where caring, attentive, and professional. It was extremely busy but this did not seem to be an issue like on my previous visit. The food arrived quickly, hot, and delicious. Everything just seemed to run so smoothly. Luke the food and beverage manager came over to talk to us about our stay and our evening so far and we gave him our compliments on the amazing difference in our two experiences. Although busy he seemed like he had all the time in the world to talk to us about our stay and ensured our room was to our requirements. Mark was also extremely attentive to our needs throughout.
reviews.title: Really good and great breakfast

reviews.text: Well done premier inn, always a great place to stay and now a great place to eat and drink as well. I will be staying a lot more in future without hesitation.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value for money .

reviews.text: Stayed overnight, auto check-in a faff but staff were fantastic and very helpful. Room clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great! Don't worry about being so close to the airport - I didn't hear a single plane!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to visit the horse of the year show , rooms large and very clean , restraunt service was very very good , the waitress we had was first class and so on the ball I would have employed her in a minute , food was of a good quality and very hot , I did however have to return something to the kitchen , I had a replacement in minutes and the whole dinner cost refunded , well done staff and management . Breakfast was better than in most 5 star hotels and had a large choice of hot and cold food , again service was the best I have had in a long time in any hotel . It's a good walk to the LG arena poss about 20 mins and through most of the car parks that are badly lit , a taxi is about £5 and is well worth it . We had a fantastic girls weekend at hoys and it was made even better by the staff and services you get at this hotel . Welldone everybody and I hope your manager is very proud of his team . We will be staying with you again .
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.text: In my room writing this as I had a lovely welcome last night, a great quality dinner, superb breakfast and above all excellent staff.
reviews.title: Moved to write about great service

reviews.text: As a regular Premier Inn resident this is by far my best experience, so thank you to all at this Hotel and please keep up this fantastic work.
reviews.title: Great value for money, fantastic staff and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done guys & hope the management appreciate the extra mile you go.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel all for just £29 per room per night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel, we stayed one night for 3 including 15 nights parking and 3 full english breakfasts for £90 what fantastic value for money,
reviews.title: STRESS FREE START TO OUR HOLIDAY

reviews.text: The staff really made our stay, Michael and Liam checked us in very professionally and Sam and Liam served breakfast and could not have been more helpful.
reviews.title: Really good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay quite friendly clean.parking brilliant as I am disabled.comfortable beds and pillows .near airport and no noise from planes and within easy reach of motorway.free 30 minute wifi excellent speed room amenities excellent lighting good
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: lovely staff... handy for NEC ( easy walk ) and also for airport... Not keen on automated check-in but girls on duty very helpful, and breakfast was great :-) .............................................................
reviews.title: pretty good

reviews.text: A new modern hotel, plenty of parking, can be busy since its next door to the NEC, clean, good quality air con, lifts, good eats, great chef, tv, wifi, good price if paid in advance, you will need to book this one or face disappointment.9.5 out of 10
reviews.title: A business trip

reviews.text: THe worst nights sleep I have had in a hotel in years. The bed was appalling, the pillows were cheap snf equally appalling. I used to tink PI were the bes of teh budgets...not now! The hotels are modern, clean and appealing but if you can't get a decent night sleep on a decnet bed what's the point
reviews.title: Rubbish Bed and Pillows

reviews.text: Very convenient for the airport (5 minutes drive) but no aircraft noise inside . High standard, comfortable, clean and very good staff. Wake-up call arrived when we asked. Best not to arrive too late as we did (10.30pm), as there were no parking spaces left on site and we had to park out on the road (watch out for yellow lines).
reviews.title: Pre-flight over-nighter

reviews.text: we stayed here as a family on 6 july for one night on our way back from feurteventura before travelling up to scotland the next day. Check in was great and express check in so easy and fast. The room was lovely big and clean. with plenty of towels and pillows and a well stocked refreshment tray. Morning time we got breakfast kids ate free to excellant value and i really recommend it. plenty of breakfast choice and no rush at all, The staff are so friendly and welcoming.. late checkout at 12;00 is ideal and short taxi to airport/ train station f for around a tenner (we did have a lot of cases). Great place and Great staff.
reviews.title: lovely hotel and lovely staff.

reviews.text: hello all
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in premier in near the NEC Birmingham although it was our first time in the premier in We were very surprised we had recevied excellent service from the staff at the reception desk good booking system on your arrival and fantastic resturants and the food friendley staff who was very attantive duration of our stay
reviews.title: Comfortable, claen and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only Hurdle was The floorboard in the room and above was very creaky otherwise we had a fantastic time We have never thought a budget hotel can provide such a good service well done premier in keep up the good work....
reviews.title: Excellant value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mrs Fernandesz
reviews.title: great for a show

reviews.text: Friendly warm welcome. Speedy check in.Could not fault any part of our stay. Staff were excellent. Room clean and quiet. Food perfect. Breakfast was great value for money, as was the whole stay. Also a decent pint in the bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic warm stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to see a show at the NEC and was looking for a one night stay in the vicinity. Found the hotel easily, arriving at 6. However had to ring and book as unable to book on the website as they were only offering stay and fly on line which was £14 more than when I rang the hotel direct (took several tries). Very busy hotel, but the check in was easy as you could use a computer, though it did not manage to give us our room keys, so we had to wait and see the receptionist anyway for the keys. Dumped our bags and made our way to the restaurant. 6.30 p.m. could not be seated until 9.45 p.m!!! restaurant far too small for the size of the hotel. Had to walk down the road to The Owl pub (attached to holiday inn express) and managed to get a bar meal. Staff member advised us we could have room service, so at about 9 we tried to ring reception to arrange this, but after 4 tries gave up!! re-read leaflet and you had to go to the restaurant to arrange room service, but by this time we were in our nightwear!! Advised to book a taxi to go to the NEC, as told to walk it would take 25 minutes, yet the hotel advertises 'we are adjacent to the NEC' On checking google, we could have walked. Staff very nice and room very comfortable and clean. Slept very well. Breakfast was self serve and ok. Again staff nice, but the cooked breakfast food was not overly hot. paying for the location!
reviews.title: Ok for a stopover!

reviews.text: I was on a roundtrip throught England and stayed just one night in Premier Inn. The hotel ist reachable from trainstation by walking just a few minutes and it resides in the center. The Rooms are elegant and the bathroom is very comfortable. Everything looks new and very clean. In addition, the staff is great and anxious. In the ground floor there is an attractive bar with a restaurant, which have a wonderful breakfast (with a buffet). I liked the price the most, because the effort was great. I can recommend this house for each time!
reviews.title: Good hotel in the center of Birmingham

reviews.text: Once you get past the self check in it all gets better. Brilliant location, no sounds from airport. Staff were we're friendly and food has improved on what it used to be. Only advice is to time your arrival to avoid busy periods, staff can get rushed. Though there are a lot of staff in the bar and restaurant later on, if it gets busy earlier than 6 they get spread a bit thin. Only real niggle was having paid for a full breakfast I had to rush off in the morning and they couldn't manage a take away coffee
reviews.title: Better than average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here to visit NEC. Flew to Birmingham from Glasgow so the location of this hotel was ideal for airport and NEC. It is possible to walk to the Premier Inn from the airport by taking the short Air-rail link to the train station and then walking through the NEC to the hotel which is at the north east corner of the NEC car parks. It will take about 20 mins, If its raining take a taxi.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise.
